Name: Glass sherd from the mouth of a vessel
Description: Iridescing glass vessel fragment, preserving part of the moulded rim, and perhaps of Roman date. In the absence of archaeological context, its interest lies in the date of acquisition, as part of the collection of antiquities formed by Lady Harriet Kavanagh. Her collection with its inventory provides a rare example of a well-documented private group of materials from the 1840s.
